summary: This document is an email chain between FBI personnel discussing victim service referrals for victims of Jeffrey Epstein's sex trafficking case. The emails focus on identifying appropriate, trauma-focused, and vetted counseling and support agencies for victims located in West Palm Beach, Florida. The correspondence reveals internal coordination efforts and concerns about ensuring victims receive proper care.

events.title: Victim requests counseling services
events.description: An Epstein victim texts an FBI contact stating that Epstein's suicide and constant visits from reporters have affected her and she needs counseling services.

events.title: Internal briefing preparation on victim referrals
events.description: FBI personnel correspond to prepare a referral list of vetted, trauma-focused agencies for Epstein victims ahead of a briefing, expressing confusion over some referral numbers and the appropriateness of services.

keyFacts: FBI Victim Specialists were actively coordinating service referrals for victims of Jeffrey Epstein's sex trafficking case in late 2019.
A specific Epstein victim in West Palm Beach was reported to be severely affected by Epstein's suicide and constant media attention, prompting an urgent need for counseling services.
Internal FBI correspondence shows a focus on using only vetted, trauma-focused agencies for victim referrals, as instructed by Executive Management due to the case's sensitivity.

The email chain reveals operational details of the FBI's victim assistance efforts, including specific agency contacts like Catholic Charities, Palm Beach County Victim Services, and the International Rescue Committee.
